Close top ad Oracle (Legacy of the Void) =========================== From Liquipedia StarCraft 2 Wiki _This article covers the current multiplayer version of this unit. For another version see [Oracle (Heart of the Swarm)](/starcraft2/Oracle_(Heart_of_the_Swarm) "Oracle (Heart of the Swarm)") ._ \[[e](https://liquipedia.net/starcraft2/index.php?title=Oracle_%28Legacy_of_the_Void%29&action=edit§ion=0)\ \]\[[h](/starcraft2/Template:Infobox_unit "Template:Infobox unit")\ \]![Protoss](https://liquipedia.net/commons/images/thumb/0/0f/Protoss_race_icon.png/30px-Protoss_race_icon.png%20%22Protoss%22) Oracle [![](https://liquipedia.net/commons/images/thumb/1/14/SC2Oracle.jpg/600px-SC2Oracle.jpg)](/starcraft2/File:SC2Oracle.jpg) [![](https://liquipedia.net/commons/images/thumb/1/14/SC2Oracle.jpg/600px-SC2Oracle.jpg)](/starcraft2/File:SC2Oracle.jpg) Unit Information Type: Air Unit Description: Flying caster. Can use Stasis Ward, Envision and Activate Pulsar Beam abilities. Built From: [Stargate](/starcraft2/Stargate "Stargate") Cost: [![](https://liquipedia.net/commons/images/a/a4/Minerals.gif)](/starcraft2/Minerals "Minerals")  150 [![](https://liquipedia.net/commons/images/2/2e/Vespene-protoss.gif)](/starcraft2/Gas "Gas")  150 [![](https://liquipedia.net/commons/images/a/a4/Buildtime_protoss.gif)](/starcraft2/Game_Speed "Game Speed")  37 [![](https://liquipedia.net/commons/images/8/86/Supply-protoss.gif)](/starcraft2/Supply "Supply")  3 [Hotkey](/starcraft2/Hotkeys_per_Race "Hotkeys per Race") : E Attack 1: Pulsar Beam Targets: Ground Damage: 15 (Pulsar Beam) [DPS](/starcraft2/Damage_Per_Second "Damage Per Second") : 24.4 [Cooldown](/starcraft2/Cooldown "Cooldown") : 0.61 Bonus: +7 vs [Light](/starcraft2/Light "Light") Bonus DPS: +11.5 vs [Light](/starcraft2/Light "Light") [Range](/starcraft2/Range "Range") : 4 Unit stats Defense: ![](https://liquipedia.net/commons/images/e/e2/Icon_Hitpoints.png) 100 [![](https://liquipedia.net/commons/images/8/82/Icon_Shields.png)](/starcraft2/Plasma_Shield "Plasma Shield") 60 [![](https://liquipedia.net/commons/images/5/5e/Icon_Armor.png)](/starcraft2/Armor "Armor") 0 (+1) Attributes: [Mechanical](/starcraft2/Mechanical "Mechanical") , [Armored](/starcraft2/Armored "Armored") , [Psionic](/starcraft2/Psionic "Psionic") Energy: 50 / 200 Sight: 10 Speed: 5.6 Strong against: * [SCV](/starcraft2/SCV_(Legacy_of_the_Void) "SCV (Legacy of the Void)") * [Drone](/starcraft2/Drone_(Legacy_of_the_Void) "Drone (Legacy of the Void)") * [Probe](/starcraft2/Probe_(Legacy_of_the_Void) "Probe (Legacy of the Void)") Weak against: * [Viking](/starcraft2/Viking_(Legacy_of_the_Void) "Viking (Legacy of the Void)") * [Mutalisk](/starcraft2/Mutalisk_(Legacy_of_the_Void) "Mutalisk (Legacy of the Void)") * [Phoenix](/starcraft2/Phoenix_(Legacy_of_the_Void) "Phoenix (Legacy of the Void)") Contents -------- * [1 Description](#Description) * [2 Spells](#Spells) * [3 Abilities](#Abilities) * [4 Competitive Use](#Competitive_Use) * [4.1 General](#General) * [4.2 Vs. Protoss](#Vs._Protoss) * [4.3 Vs. Terran](#Vs._Terran) * [4.4 Vs. Zerg](#Vs._Zerg) * [5 Other](#Other) * [5.1 History](#History) * [6 Gallery](#Gallery) * [7 Quotes](#Quotes) * [8 Patch Changes](#Patch_Changes) * [9 External Links](#External_Links) * [10 References](#References) Description\[[edit](/starcraft2/index.php?title=Oracle_(Legacy_of_the_Void)&action=edit§ion=1 "Edit section: Description")\ \] --------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- The **Oracle** is a flying harassment and support caster for the [Protoss](/starcraft2/Protoss "Protoss") that is produced from the [Stargate](/starcraft2/Stargate "Stargate") . In [LotV](/starcraft2/LotV "LotV") the ability [Stasis Ward](/starcraft2/Stasis_Ward "Stasis Ward") was added. While fairly expensive and fragile, the Oracle is a very mobile unit and has several useful spells. Its attack, **Pulsar Beam** must be activated for an energy cost before it can be used and also drains energy while the ability is activated. It rapidly destroys workers and other light units, although anti-air units and structures will quickly kill it. The Oracle is also an effective scout and can be used as a temporary detector. Spells\[[edit](/starcraft2/index.php?title=Oracle_(Legacy_of_the_Void)&action=edit§ion=2 "Edit section: Spells")\ \] ----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- [Revelation](/starcraft2/Revelation "Revelation") | | | | --- | --- | | [![](https://liquipedia.net/commons/images/7/70/Preordain.png)](/starcraft2/File:Preordain.png) | **Caster:** [Oracle](/starcraft2/Oracle "Oracle")

**[![](https://liquipedia.net/commons/images/a/a9/EnergyIcon.gif)](/starcraft2/Energy "Energy")
** 25

**[Range](/starcraft2/Range "Range")
:** 9

**[Cooldown](/starcraft2/Cooldown "Cooldown")
:** 10 s

**[Duration](/starcraft2/Game_Speed "Game Speed")
:** 20 s

**Radius:** 6

**[Hotkey](/starcraft2/Hotkeys_per_Race "Hotkeys per Race")
:** R

Causes enemy units and structures within the target area to grant vision for 20 seconds. Reveals cloaked or burrowed units and structures. | [Stasis Ward](/starcraft2/Stasis_Ward "Stasis Ward") | | | | --- | --- | | [![](https://liquipedia.net/commons/images/thumb/5/53/Stasis_Ward.png/61px-Stasis_Ward.png)](/starcraft2/File:Stasis_Ward.png) | **Caster:** [Oracle](/starcraft2/Oracle "Oracle")

**[![](https://liquipedia.net/commons/images/a/a9/EnergyIcon.gif)](/starcraft2/Energy "Energy")
** 50

**[Range](/starcraft2/Range "Range")
:** 6

**[Duration](/starcraft2/Game_Speed "Game Speed")
:** 3.58 s

**Radius:** 4

**[Hotkey](/starcraft2/Hotkeys_per_Race "Hotkeys per Race")
:** T

Places a cloaked Stasis Ward at the target location that lasts 170 seconds. Once activated by an enemy ground unit, the ward traps nearby enemies in stasis for 21.5 seconds. Trapped units cannot be attacked or affected by abilities. | [Activate Pulsar Beam](/starcraft2/Activate_Pulsar_Beam "Activate Pulsar Beam") | | | | --- | --- | | [![](https://liquipedia.net/commons/images/thumb/9/92/PulsarBeam.png/62px-PulsarBeam.png)](/starcraft2/File:PulsarBeam.png) | **Caster:** [Oracle](/starcraft2/Oracle "Oracle")

**[![](https://liquipedia.net/commons/images/a/a9/EnergyIcon.gif)](/starcraft2/Energy "Energy")
** 25 (-1.96/s)

**[Cooldown](/starcraft2/Cooldown "Cooldown")
:** 4

**[Hotkey](/starcraft2/Hotkeys_per_Race "Hotkeys per Race")
:** C

Charges the Oracle's Pulsar Beam, which does 15 (+7 vs [Light](/starcraft2/Light "Light")
) spell damage to ground units while active. | Abilities\[[edit](/starcraft2/index.php?title=Oracle_(Legacy_of_the_Void)&action=edit§ion=3 "Edit section: Abilities")\ \] ----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- Deactivate Pulsar Beam | | | | --- | --- | | [![](https://liquipedia.net/commons/images/thumb/5/57/Deactivate_Pulsar_Beam.png/62px-Deactivate_Pulsar_Beam.png)](/starcraft2/File:Deactivate_Pulsar_Beam.png) | **Caster:** [Oracle](/starcraft2/Oracle "Oracle")

**[Hotkey](/starcraft2/Hotkeys_per_Race "Hotkeys per Race")
:** D

Deactivates the Oracle's Pulsar Beam and prevents it from attacking. | Competitive Use\[[edit](/starcraft2/index.php?title=Oracle_(Legacy_of_the_Void)&action=edit§ion=4 "Edit section: Competitive Use")\ \] ----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- ### General\[[edit](/starcraft2/index.php?title=Oracle_(Legacy_of_the_Void)&action=edit§ion=5 "Edit section: General")\ \] ### Vs.[![](https://liquipedia.net/commons/images/thumb/e/e4/ProtossIcon.png/30px-ProtossIcon.png)](/starcraft2/File:ProtossIcon.png) Protoss\[[edit](/starcraft2/index.php?title=Oracle_(Legacy_of_the_Void)&action=edit§ion=6 "Edit section: Vs. Protoss")\ \] Proxy Stargate play has seen some competitive play, and if unscouted can cause serious damage to the opponent's economy. Oracles are also common in the mid-late game of this matchup thanks to their envision ability, allowing a player to constantly keep track of their enemy. It is also convenient that they can be acquired while on the way to [Tempests](/starcraft2/Tempest_(Legacy_of_the_Void) "Tempest (Legacy of the Void)") , a very powerful unit in this matchup's lategame. ### Vs.[![](https://liquipedia.net/commons/images/thumb/9/94/TerranIcon.png/30px-TerranIcon.png)](/starcraft2/File:TerranIcon.png) Terran\[[edit](/starcraft2/index.php?title=Oracle_(Legacy_of_the_Void)&action=edit§ion=7 "Edit section: Vs. Terran")\ \] Oracle play against Terran can be a gamble due to Marines. Against a greedy or unprepared Terran an Oracle opening will do devastating damage to the economy. If the Terran player scouts the build or amasses a large number of marines though, the build can be shut down quite quickly. However, surviving oracles are still useful support units, as their fast speed will help deal with small Terran drops in conjunction with photon overcharge. Some players also utilize revelation to great effect in scaring away drops and spotting the late game Terran army to get off critical storms. It is important to note that a single Oracle can take up to five [Marines](/starcraft2/Marine "Marine") without [Combat Shield](/starcraft2/Combat_Shield "Combat Shield") , while two Oracles are only able to eliminate a group of eight or less Marines, these facts are important to remember while going for an Oracle rush or defending one. [Widow Mines](/starcraft2/Widow_Mine "Widow Mine") are also an effective counter to Oracles as they can one shot them, so watching for them is important when entering a Terran base with Oracles. ### Vs.[![](https://liquipedia.net/commons/images/thumb/d/d1/ZergIcon.png/30px-ZergIcon.png)](/starcraft2/File:ZergIcon.png) Zerg\[[edit](/starcraft2/index.php?title=Oracle_(Legacy_of_the_Void)&action=edit§ion=8 "Edit section: Vs. Zerg")\ \] Oracle and [Phoenix](/starcraft2/Phoenix "Phoenix") openings are the current meta for PvZ and are seen in most games. This is because it forces a response out of the Zerg to create [Spore Crawlers](/starcraft2/Spore_Crawler_(Legacy_of_the_Void) "Spore Crawler (Legacy of the Void)") and keep their Queens in position. In addition Oracles are useful for defending the unfinished 3rd base against large masses of [Zerglings](/starcraft2/Zergling "Zergling") as well as provide substantial early-mid-game defense. Oracles can also be useful in mid- and late-game because of their Revelation ability, removing a Zerg army's ability to freely attack anywhere on the map. Also, it may be worth noting that Oracles can kill [Larva](/starcraft2/Larva "Larva") very quickly because they die from a 2 oracle attacks, which can leave the Zerg unable to produce additional units. Other\[[edit](/starcraft2/index.php?title=Oracle_(Legacy_of_the_Void)&action=edit§ion=9 "Edit section: Other")\ \] --------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- [![](https://liquipedia.net/commons/images/thumb/4/4e/StasisOrb.jpg/200px-StasisOrb.jpg)](/starcraft2/File:StasisOrb.jpg) [](/starcraft2/File:StasisOrb.jpg "Enlarge") The early Oracle model bears many similarities to the [Stasis Orb](/starcraft2/Stasis_Orb "Stasis Orb") of the Wings of Liberty alpha * The unit model was based on the [Stasis Orb](/starcraft2/Stasis_Orb "Stasis Orb") design, adjusted to fit a Dark Templar theme.[\[1\]](#) * **Revelation** puts a seal on units in the area the ability was cast on, the seal lasts for 15 seconds and reveals the units it is placed upon. * With this ability and the Oracle's fast movement speed, tracking and spotting enemy armies becomes a simple task. This ability detects [Cloaked](/starcraft2/Cloak "Cloak") or [Burrowed](/starcraft2/Burrow "Burrow") units. * **Activate Pulsar Beam** is a spell that costs 25 energy to activate and 1.4 energy per second thereafter; it enables the Oracle to attack ground units with a high-damage beam that can two-shot workers (SCVs are 3 shot) and marines without [Combat Shield](/starcraft2/Combat_Shield "Combat Shield") . The Pulsar Beam is the main weapon of the Oracle and can take out a large number of workers in a short time. Therefore it is important to activate the ability at the last possible second to deal maximum damage. * To be energy efficient, the Pulsar Beam must be turned off for 11.43 seconds (turning it off and on vs. just leaving it on). * **Stasis Ward** is the newest ability of the Oracle. While it traps units for 30 seconds, the units trapped cannot be attacked or affected by abilities. The Protoss player can however use this time to take a favorable army placement. This ability can also be used to split an army in two. ### History\[[edit](/starcraft2/index.php?title=Oracle_(Legacy_of_the_Void)&action=edit§ion=10 "Edit section: History")\ \] The Oracle and [Tempest](/starcraft2/Tempest_(unit) "Tempest (unit)") were designed so that Protoss could make more use of the [Stargate](/starcraft2/Stargate "Stargate") in the early-game and that it would be possible to go for Stargate based armies in the late-game, given that it was an unpopular choice for most of Wings of Liberty (outside of PvP and PvZ early-game, and PvZ extreme late-game). Besides the [Warp Prism](/starcraft2/Warp_Prism "Warp Prism") , it was felt that the Protoss race lacked a way for harassment, and that is another reason why the Oracle was created. html:
Oracle (Legacy of the Void)

From Liquipedia StarCraft 2 Wiki
This article covers the current multiplayer version of this unit. For another version see Oracle (Heart of the Swarm).
[e][h] Oracle
Unit Information
Type:
Air Unit
Description:
Flying caster. Can use Stasis Ward, Envision and Activate Pulsar Beam abilities.
Built From:
Stargate
Cost:
 150  150  37  3
Hotkey:
E
Attack 1: Pulsar Beam
Targets:
Ground
Damage:
15 (Pulsar Beam)
DPS:
24.4
Cooldown:
0.61
Bonus:
+7 vs Light
Bonus DPS:
+11.5 vs Light
Range:
4
Unit stats
Defense:
100 60 0 (+1)
Attributes:
Mechanical, Armored, Psionic
Energy:
50 / 200
Sight:
10
Speed:
5.6
Strong against:
  • SCV
  • Drone
  • Probe
Weak against:
  • Viking
  • Mutalisk
  • Phoenix

Contents

  • 1 Description
  • 2 Spells
  • 3 Abilities
  • 4 Competitive Use
    • 4.1 General
    • 4.2 Vs. Protoss
    • 4.3 Vs. Terran
    • 4.4 Vs. Zerg
  • 5 Other
    • 5.1 History
  • 6 Gallery
  • 7 Quotes
  • 8 Patch Changes
  • 9 External Links
  • 10 References

Description[edit]

The Oracle is a flying harassment and support caster for the Protoss that is produced from the Stargate. In LotV the ability Stasis Ward was added.

While fairly expensive and fragile, the Oracle is a very mobile unit and has several useful spells. Its attack, Pulsar Beam must be activated for an energy cost before it can be used and also drains energy while the ability is activated. It rapidly destroys workers and other light units, although anti-air units and structures will quickly kill it. The Oracle is also an effective scout and can be used as a temporary detector.

Spells[edit]

Revelation
Caster: Oracle
25
Range: 9
Cooldown: 10 s
Duration: 20 s
Radius: 6
Hotkey: R
Causes enemy units and structures within the target area to grant vision for 20 seconds. Reveals cloaked or burrowed units and structures.
Stasis Ward
Caster: Oracle
50
Range: 6
Duration: 3.58 s
Radius: 4
Hotkey: T
Places a cloaked Stasis Ward at the target location that lasts 170 seconds. Once activated by an enemy ground unit, the ward traps nearby enemies in stasis for 21.5 seconds. Trapped units cannot be attacked or affected by abilities.
Activate Pulsar Beam
Caster: Oracle
25 (-1.96/s)
Cooldown: 4
Hotkey: C
Charges the Oracle's Pulsar Beam, which does 15 (+7 vs Light) spell damage to ground units while active.

Abilities[edit]

Deactivate Pulsar Beam
Caster: Oracle
Hotkey: D
Deactivates the Oracle's Pulsar Beam and prevents it from attacking.

Competitive Use[edit]

General[edit]

Vs. Protoss[edit]

Proxy Stargate play has seen some competitive play, and if unscouted can cause serious damage to the opponent's economy.

Oracles are also common in the mid-late game of this matchup thanks to their envision ability, allowing a player to constantly keep track of their enemy. It is also convenient that they can be acquired while on the way to Tempests, a very powerful unit in this matchup's lategame.

Vs. Terran[edit]

Oracle play against Terran can be a gamble due to Marines. Against a greedy or unprepared Terran an Oracle opening will do devastating damage to the economy. If the Terran player scouts the build or amasses a large number of marines though, the build can be shut down quite quickly. However, surviving oracles are still useful support units, as their fast speed will help deal with small Terran drops in conjunction with photon overcharge. Some players also utilize revelation to great effect in scaring away drops and spotting the late game Terran army to get off critical storms.

It is important to note that a single Oracle can take up to five Marines without Combat Shield, while two Oracles are only able to eliminate a group of eight or less Marines, these facts are important to remember while going for an Oracle rush or defending one.

Widow Mines are also an effective counter to Oracles as they can one shot them, so watching for them is important when entering a Terran base with Oracles.

Vs. Zerg[edit]

Oracle and Phoenix openings are the current meta for PvZ and are seen in most games. This is because it forces a response out of the Zerg to create Spore Crawlers and keep their Queens in position. In addition Oracles are useful for defending the unfinished 3rd base against large masses of Zerglings as well as provide substantial early-mid-game defense. Oracles can also be useful in mid- and late-game because of their Revelation ability, removing a Zerg army's ability to freely attack anywhere on the map. Also, it may be worth noting that Oracles can kill Larva very quickly because they die from a 2 oracle attacks, which can leave the Zerg unable to produce additional units.

Other[edit]

The early Oracle model bears many similarities to the Stasis Orb of the Wings of Liberty alpha
  • The unit model was based on the Stasis Orb design, adjusted to fit a Dark Templar theme.[1]
  • Revelation puts a seal on units in the area the ability was cast on, the seal lasts for 15 seconds and reveals the units it is placed upon.
    • With this ability and the Oracle's fast movement speed, tracking and spotting enemy armies becomes a simple task. This ability detects Cloaked or Burrowed units.
  • Activate Pulsar Beam is a spell that costs 25 energy to activate and 1.4 energy per second thereafter; it enables the Oracle to attack ground units with a high-damage beam that can two-shot workers (SCVs are 3 shot) and marines without Combat Shield. The Pulsar Beam is the main weapon of the Oracle and can take out a large number of workers in a short time. Therefore it is important to activate the ability at the last possible second to deal maximum damage.
    • To be energy efficient, the Pulsar Beam must be turned off for 11.43 seconds (turning it off and on vs. just leaving it on).
  • Stasis Ward is the newest ability of the Oracle. While it traps units for 30 seconds, the units trapped cannot be attacked or affected by abilities. The Protoss player can however use this time to take a favorable army placement. This ability can also be used to split an army in two.

History[edit]

The Oracle and Tempest were designed so that Protoss could make more use of the Stargate in the early-game and that it would be possible to go for Stargate based armies in the late-game, given that it was an unpopular choice for most of Wings of Liberty (outside of PvP and PvZ early-game, and PvZ extreme late-game). Besides the Warp Prism, it was felt that the Protoss race lacked a way for harassment, and that is another reason why the Oracle was created.

Gallery[edit]

Quotes[edit]

[hide][show]Quotes
Built Selected Annoyed Move Under Attack
  • Oracle perceiving.
  • Dimensional strings attuned.
  • Let us begin.
  • An omen.
  • You seek guidance?
  • The threads of fate lie bare.
  • Our window is short.
  • How can I aide you?
  • We are the architects of fate.
  • No you cannot see my software.
  • en arudin Raszagal
  • Let us peer into possible futures.
  • Always in motion is the future, difficult to see.[q 1]
  • I see someone important to you is in danger. Their name begins with a "g". No? maybe a "b"?
  • Spartan must not go to war during Carnea. oops a little late on that one.
  • No man should know too much about their destiny. It's perfectly okay for women though.
  • Time is on my side! Yes it is.
  • You want to go to war? I don't think you have the minerals.
  • We interpret.
  • I see.
  • Harmonized.
  • Our fates are one.
  • It is destined.
  • Extrapolating strings.
  • The stars align.
  • Na-Zuk-Tai.
  • We meet our fate. (death)
  • The enemy has discovered us.
  1. ↑ from Star Wars: Episode V - The Empire Strikes Back

Oracle's quotes (video and sound) - YouTube video.

Patch Changes[edit]

[hide][show]Patch 4.0.0 [2]
  • Revelation
    • Duration reduced from 43 to 30 seconds.
  • Stasis Ward
    • Will no longer affect Zerg larva or eggs.
    • Stasis Ward has a 170 second timed life duration.
  • Pulsar Beam weapon changed from Spell to Normal damage. Armor will now reduce the Pulsar Beam damage.
[hide][show]Patch 4.0.2 Balance Update [3]
  • Pulsar Beam
    • Damage reduced from 15 (+10 Light) to 15 (+7 Light).
    • Pulsar Beam damage type changed from normal to spell damage.
  • Increase build time from 37 to 43 seconds.
[hide][show]Patch 4.1.1 Balance Update[4]
  • Build time reduced from 43 to 37 seconds.
[hide][show]Patch 4.8.2 [5]
  • Removed the Light attribute.
  • Added the Armored attribute.
[hide][show]Patch 4.11.0 [6]
  • Fixed an issue where beam attacks could deal more damage than intended.
[hide][show]Patch 4.12.0 [7]
  • Revelation energy cost decreased from 50 to 25.
  • Revelation cooldown increased from 2 seconds to 10 seconds.
  • Revelation duration decreased from 30 seconds to 15 seconds.
[hide][show]Patch 5.0.2 BU [8]
  • Revelation duration increased from 15 seconds to 20 seconds.
[hide][show]Patch 5.0.12 [9]
  • Stasis Ward sight range increased from 4 to 7.
